terms.title: Terms of Use
terms.intro: Welcome to DisasterMatch. These Terms of Use ("Terms") govern your access to and use of the DisasterMatch website, products, and services. By accessing or using our platform, you agree to be bound by these Terms.

section1.title: 1. Who May Use the Service
section1.p1: You must be at least 18 years old to register for an account or purchase content on DisasterMatch. By using the Service you represent and warrant that you are at least 18 and have legal capacity to enter into these Terms.
section1.p2: The Service is available to any individual or business. DisasterMatch’s intended audience includes contractors working with insurance companies, but anyone may create an account and purchase incident data cards.

section2.title: 2. Description of Service
section2.p1: DisasterMatch aggregates and presents incident data ("Incident Cards" or "Cards") that are compiled from third-party sources, including paid third‑party websites and public emergency call records. Each Card displays information such as state, city, a short description, date and time, and an indication whether the Card is “complete” or “incomplete.”
section2.p2: When you purchase a Card, DisasterMatch delivers the information associated with that Card to the email address you provide during checkout (for example, purchase confirmation and incident details as in the sample email included on our site).
section2.p3: A Card marked complete indicates DisasterMatch has captured all key fields for that incident. A Card marked incomplete means one or more key data fields (for example: phone, email, or address) are missing; incomplete Cards are priced lower.

section3.title: 3. Account Registration and Security
section3.p1: To use certain features you must create an account. You agree to provide accurate, current, and complete information and to update it as needed. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials and for all activity that occurs under your account. Notify us immediately of any unauthorized use of your account.
section3.p2: You may not share account credentials, and you agree not to transfer or sell your account without DisasterMatch’s prior written consent.

section4.title: 4. Purchases, Payment, and Invoicing
section4.p1: All purchases are one‑time purchases for the specific Card(s) bought. We do not offer subscriptions or commission-based arrangements by default.
section4.p2: By purchasing a Card you authorize DisasterMatch to charge the payment method provided. You are responsible for any applicable taxes. After purchase, DisasterMatch will send a confirmation email and an invoice (when applicable) to the email address you supply. The confirmation email will contain the details of the purchased incidents.
section4.p3: No refunds. All purchases are final and non-refundable once the incident details are delivered to you. To the fullest extent permitted by law, purchases are non-refundable even if the information later proves to be inaccurate or incomplete.

q1.question: 1. What is Disaster Match?
q1.answer1: Disaster Match is a platform that connects people affected by disasters with contractors or professionals who offer their services to assist them.

q2.question: 2. How does the information purchase system work?
q2.answer1: When a contractor wants to learn more about a specific incident (for example, a property affected by fire), they can purchase full access to the affected person’s information. This includes contact details, a description of the damage, and the approximate location.

q3.question: 3. Who can register on Disaster Match?
q3.answer1: Anyone can register on the platform:
q3.answer2:
- Contractors or companies looking to offer their services to affected individuals.
- Individuals who want to request assistance after a disaster.

q4.question: 4. Is it safe to purchase information on the platform?
q4.answer1: Yes. Disaster Match protects users’ personal data through strong security protocols and only shares information with verified contractors who purchase access to incident details.

q5.question: 5. How can I purchase information about an affected person?
q5.answer1: Go to the “Available Incidents” section, select the case you’re interested in, and click “Add to Cart.” The system will display the price in your cart. Once payment is confirmed, you’ll gain full access to the affected person’s details and incident information.

q6.question: 6. What payment methods does Disaster Match accept?
q6.answer1: Currently, we accept credit and debit card payments, as well as other electronic payment options depending on the user’s region.

q7.question: 7. What happens after purchasing the information?
q7.answer1: Once the purchase is complete, you’ll be able to view all the details of the incident and the contact information of the affected person to offer your services or coordinate assistance directly.

q8.question: 8. Can I modify or delete my account?
q8.answer1: Yes. In the “Profile” section, you can update your personal information or request permanent deletion of your account at any time.

q9.question: 9. What if I have a problem with payment or viewing an incident?
q9.answer1: You can contact our support team through the live chat for immediate assistance with any payment or access issues.

q10.question: 10. Can I use Disaster Match from my phone?
q10.answer1: Yes. Disaster Match is fully compatible with mobile devices and can be accessed through any modern web browser.

q11.question: 11. How can I search for a specific disaster?
q11.answer1: In the “Available Incidents” section, you can use advanced filters to find specific or general cases.
q11.answer2: Filters allow you to search by disaster type (fire, flood, earthquake, etc.), location, date of the incident, or reported damage level.
